column4: Does anyone know what I can do to activate and use Atheros-card in 9.10?
It didn't get installed by default.
did you install the driver?
From where?
run grep -r "ath5k" /etc/modprobe.d/
Before I do this, will this disconnect me?
nah just checks for the driver
/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-ath_pci.conf:# which ath5k cannot recover. To prevent this condition, stop
edit /etc/modprobe.d and tell me if it is blacklisted ath5k
Edit it with WHAT? Gedit doesn't have the rights to open it even if I open it with sudo.
umm there should be a blacklist.conf file in that folder
wait just type in ifconfig and see if you have wlan0 or wifi0 etc
http://paste.ubuntu.com/356035/
type in ifconfig and press enter
THEN what?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/356037/

notice the lines wlan1     Link encap:Ethernet  HWaddr 00:18:f8:2c:17:56    AND        inet addr:192.168.1.33  Bcast:192.168.1.255  Mask:255.255.255.0 ? this means your connected to a wireless network
you do not have two wireless adapters by any chance?
Yes, via a USB-connected wireless stick yes.
okay, well both seems to be installed and working okay, but only one is configured (wlan1, not wlan0) download Wicd network manager to configure them in GUI or through CLI use iwconfig
07:00.0 Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR5001 Wireless Network Adapter (rev 01)
like i said its already installed, but not configured, that card would have mac address 00:26:5e:04:31:00 if i am correct, and the one youre using now would have : 00:18:f8:2c:17:56
to make it "active" you HAVE to configure it! i suggest using Wicd Network manager.
it will help you switch between the two without disconnecting etc
